Message.Title: The Democratic constituency defined..Who said that?
Message.Msg: The Democratic constituency is just like a herd of cows. All you have to do is lay out enough silage and they come running. That’s why I became an operative working with Democrats. With Democrats all you have to do is make a lot of noise, lay out the hay, and be ready to use the ole cattle prod in case a few want to bolt the herd. Eighty percent of the people who call themselves Democrats don’t have a clue as to political reality. What amazes me is that you could take a group of people who are hard workers and convince them that they should support social programs that were the exact opposite of their own personal convictions. Put a little fear here and there and you can get people to vote any way you want. The voter is basically dumb and lazy. The reason I became a Democratic operative instead of a Republican was because there were more Democrats that didn’t have a clue than there were Republicans. Truth is relative. Truth is what you can make the voter believe is the truth. If you’re smart enough, truth is what you make the voter think it is. That’s why I’m a Democrat. I can make the Democratic voters think whatever I want them to.”

Message.Title: The Cliff isn't that complicated, is it?
Message.Msg: So far the debate has been boring with useless posturing and silly horse trading & hostage taking. It reminds you of 5th graders on the playground. There are 4 broad questions: (1) Continue the Bush tax cuts on the rich or not? (2) Continue the Bush tax cuts on everyone else or not? (3) Make the called for cuts in military spending or not? (4) Make the called for cuts in other spending or not? Why won't the House & Senate leadership allow 4 separate, very simple bills addressing each question to reach their floors for recorded votes with no amendments allowed? Let's see who votes for (and against) what. Afterwards the very important members can continue to posture and talk and the rest of us can continue to ignore them.

Message.Title: this week, 25 of nov 12
Message.Msg: Ill’s sr senator, Dick Durbin, feels that “We can solve the problem of the fiscal cliff”. GOP Sen Lindsay Graham, SC, considers sequester, if it occurs, will devastate the USA military. He also considers capping income tax deductions the money raising route, not increasing tax rates on the rich, because “job creation” would be impeded. Sen Durbin also feels that we can make meaningful changes to Medicaid and Medicare, but he considers Social Security not involved in national debt matters; argues, though, the top tax rate must be increased. Graham, re Benghazi, says the attack was not video/film motivated. He also cited communications that showed embassy personnel in Benghazi sought reinforcing weeks before the attack occurred. UN ambassador Rice criticized. Roundtable—Matthew Dowd anticipates a short term deal; Ruth Marcus of Washington Post considers the House rigid re the matter (fiscal cliff is ‘the matter’) Changing subject, Marcus credits the Egyptian president and the Muslim Brotherhood as helpful re the Gaza situation. Dowd’s view re the GOP in coming months—it must have candidates and views reflecting the current USA climate, not expect the USA to change towards GOP right wing views. Marcus feels the GOP is capable of change; Joe Klein, of Time, says the GOP must become, again, the party of the middle class. Actor/activist Ben Affleck is distressed by conditions in the Congo. He speaks of 3 million deaths, and little engagement by USA. He spoke, too, of an aid group in trouble that was assisted by govt security forces—no “bribe” money wanted, it turns out the unit was the one trained by USA. Ages 23 and 24, the 3 members of the USA military in Afghanistan who made the ultimate sacrifice—South Carolina, Minnesota and Arkansas their home states. Sponsors—N Y State economic development—twice. Dell and IBM, also twice. National car rental (once), life insurance and natural gas pressure groups, latter group two spots. Etrade, one rich car ad, one Chevron, also mentioning shale as source of USA natural gas. No BAC, but yes Etrade. No In memoriam, or “guess which year” but one scene of GOP and Dem political operatives paying off debt by close haircuts, benefit “help kids with cancer group”
